page.title: 20In Conclusion
page.content: The village of Brockenhurst and the surrounding area offers a wide variety of people, housing, entertainments, facilities and events. In a village whose population can triple in a weekend, where London executives live alongside water bailiffs and gamekeepers, it is expected that difficulties and conflicts of interest will arise. The village tries to retain its individual identity but finds the pressure of tourism very demanding. Educationally the village supports a huge student population of 1200 children between 3 and 18 some of whom travel up to 20 miles to attend college yet the children aged 11-16 must travel out of Brockenhurst into Dorset for their education. An unusual area but a very nice place to live.
